newsitem.title: UK: Bryant shares rise, says Admiral on target.
newsitem.headline: Bryant shares rise, says Admiral on target.

text.p: Shares in Bryant Group Plc advanced on Thursday after the construction company confirmed that newly-acquired Admiral Homes was completely integrated into its own homes operations.
Bryant also said the enlarged group was on target for 4,000 completions in the year to 31 May 1997 and set to move towards its medium term target of 6,000 homes a year.
The stock put on 3-1/2p to 129p by 1034 GMT.
"This is confirmation of a positive trend. Sometimes when people buy something they get a bit overexcited but that is clearly not so in this case," said BZW analyst, Howard Seymour.
Analysts said the sector was catching up as prospects improved, having lagged the market, and particularly so in the wake of good results on Wednesday from housebuilder Bellway Plc.
